barker_notes.barker_summary: Asking for an appointment to see him
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 395

div1.p: Asking for an appointment to see him

I am anxious to see you and since I have heard of your return I have been endeavouring to do so. I have just returned from Columbia where I expected to meet you and would now go to Velasco if I was certain you was there If possible I would be glad if you would come up, or otherwise name the place where I can see you in a few days
